title: 'Drunk woman, 26, woke up with man raping her on sofa after night out'
text:

A 26-year-old man “took advantage of the vulnerable situation” a drunk woman was in to rape her, a court was told.

A jury heard how Joshua Banana’s victim woke up with her jumpsuit and pants down by her ankles with him on top of her, DerbyshireLive reports.

Giving evidence, she said she asked him “what the hell are you doing?” before pushing him off.

The woman, who is in her 20s, said she then ran upstairs almost naked to where her female friend was in a bedroom with a different man.

Banana, of Leaper Street, and who is on trial at Derby Crown Court for rape, denies the charge.

He says the pair had fully consensual sex at the house.

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)

Prosecutor Andrew Vout, opening the trial, said: “In the early hours on the morning of April 29, 2018, the victim was passed out on a sofa in a house in Derby.

“She’d had a lot to drink that night.

“She had been on a night out with friends and this defendant, Joseph Banana, decided to take advantage of her while she was in this vulnerable situation.

“He raped her.”

Mr Vout said the victim had been drinking heavily and had taken cocaine while on the night out with friends.

He said her evening ended at a number of bars and then clubs.

While there, one of her friends got chatting to a group including the defendant, and it was agreed that some of them would go back to the Normanton house of one of the men to continue drinking and dancing.

Mr Vout said that, while there, the victim ended up unconscious and drunk on a sofa.

Giving evidence, the woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, said she woke at around 8.30am to find the defendant behind her making a grunting noise.

The woman said: “I was drunk, I don’t remember getting on the sofa or anything.

“That was my last recollection until I came around.

“When I did I was bent over the sofa with my jumpsuit around my ankles, my pants around my ankles and this man behind me.

“I thought ‘what the hell? What the hell is going on?’

“I said ‘what the hell are you doing?’ and I ran upstairs to where my friend was.

“I was a proper mess, I was screaming, shouting, crying, I still had my pants around my ankles.”

Mr Vout said the friend called for a taxi and dialled 999 and police went to the house.

He said when they knocked at the door the defendant tried to flee over a fence but was caught.

In a prepared statement he said he did not rape the woman and they had consensual sex.

Mr Vout said the defendant later told the police she put two sofas together to facilitate it.

He said: “He said she was lying, that she enthusiastically consented and that she might have made up the allegation because he said something which upset her when they were having sex.”

The trial continues.
description: A court heard how the victim asked “what the hell are you doing?” before pushing her alleged attacker off and running upstairs
